thread.title: Sisters sing for Rocky fans at Glenmore Homestead gig
thread.title_full: Sisters sing for Rocky fans at Glenmore Homestead gig

title: Sisters sing for Rocky fans at Glenmore Homestead gig
text:
Sisters sing for Rocky fans at Glenmore Homestead gig Amy Haydock | 9th Oct 2015 7:11 PM Amy Haydock Rachel and Rebecca are living out their musical dreams, travelling the country and offering their sound to fresh ears and faces. Contributed 
CREATIVE people exist in all sorts of places. 
Acoustic duo, singer-songwriters and sisters from Wowan, Innocent Eve are no exception. 
Clocking up over 50,000km in their tour car, Rachel and Rebecca are living out their musical dreams, travelling the country and offering their sound to fresh ears and faces. 
But Rockhampton isn't an unfamiliar place for them to stop and play every once in a while, and the Glenmore Homestead will host the sweet-sounding sisters for the second time on October 31. 
Chatting to Pulse yesterday before they embark on their fourth Cruisin' Country gig aboard a cruse ship, the girls said they loved taking their sound wherever they were welcome. 
"It's been really exciting, and it's so good to be able to get our music to different people," Rebecca said. 
"It's so fun wherever we go on the road, and radio been quite supportive of getting our music out there as well." 
The girl's debut album, Temporary Balms, was recorded last year at Tommirock Studios in Newcastle, NSW, by the ARIA-charting producer Joel Black. 
Since its release in April this year, they've been celebrating its success. 
Their first and second singles, A Little Bit and Into The Light, have both charted in the KIX FM All Australian Top 20 and both are available for request on the Country Music Channel. 
"The last show we played at the Glenmore Homestead was a week after Cyclone Marcia," Rebecca explained. 
"So some people weren't able to make it, and they got a lot of inquiries after that about when they would be holding an event out there like that again. 
"We're really happy with the vibe and the feel out there, so it should be a great night." 
IF YOU GO 
WHEN: Saturday, October 31, from 6.30pm 
WHERE: Glenmore Homestead 
Find them on Facebook or go to innocenteve.com.au glenmore homestead
